messageBody:
Thanks Andreas - I'm a little bit of a purist when it
comes to keeping the code as clean and simple as
possible, so I try not to put code in components that
is only there for the sake of testing.

In the end, unless there's some Maven magic here, I'll
probably just let maven create and clean the
directories in the root project directory, since
there's no conflict between the directories created
and the project directories.

In the long run it would be really great to be able to
trick the test into running in src/test/output though.
I would think there would be a System parameter or
something to enable this...

Thanks again,
- Ole

--- Andreas Guther <Andreas.Guther@...>
wrote:

> Ole,
>
>
>
> I am not sure if you can do that in Maven. But I
> think it might be
> worth thinking about passing in the base folder to
> your class under test
> (Dependency Injection Pattern) rather than having
> the class computing
> it. In situations like that I sometime use in my
> class under test a
> setter method for a base folder that I only use in a
> test environment.
> The class under test checks if the folder is already
> set, if not, it
> does the standard behavior in computing the current
> folder, etc. You
> could have a check for null and since the setter
> method is not used in
> production, the variable would be null in
> production.
>
>
>
> Andreas

> ole_ersoy wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > Does anyone know whether I can specify which
> directory
> > a junit test will run in.
> >
> > Let me elaborate a little.
> >
> > I'm using Maven to run the tests, but in this case
> I want the
> > test to think that it is running in a directory
> "src/test/output"
> > relative to the directory that the tests are
> launced from.
> >
> > In other words I want the JUnit test to think it
> is being run from
> >
> > $basedir/src/test/output, when I'm really running
> it from $basedir.
> >
> > The component I'm testing creates directories, so
> my end goal is to
> > have that component create the directories
> relative to
> >
> > $basedir/src/test/output
> >
